scenes.background: You are on annual leave, enjoying some well-deserved time off to recharge. However, during your time away, a colleague messages you privately, saying thereâ€™s an urgent task that needs immediate attention. The request creates a dilemma as you try to balance respecting your time off while feeling the pressure to help with the urgent task. You chose to take a quick look and help out. After some time, [Monica] and [Bob] approach you in the cafeteria. [Monica] looks slightly concerned while [Bob] seems indifferent. [Monica] says, 'Hey [Alex], I heard you helped out with the urgent task during your leave. That's really commendable, but don't you think it's setting a precedent for others to bother you on your days off?' You responded assertively, stating that maybe the team needs to be more self-reliant. Now, [Monica] frowns slightly and [Bob] raises an eyebrow. [Bob] remarks, 'Well, if everyone just starts saying no to extra work, won't that leave us in a bind during real emergencies?'
scenes.description: Monica crosses her arms and Bob looks at you expectantly as you take a moment to consider your response.

options.text: True, but maybe we need a better system for handling emergencies without always relying on someone's day off.
options.analysis: You acknowledge the concern while suggesting a constructive solution, showing good self-regulation and social skills.

options.text: I see your point, Bob. Perhaps I should have thought about the long-term implications.
options.analysis: You agree with the concern, showing empathy and emotional perception but lower social skills and motivation.

options.text: If handling emergencies means sacrificing personal time, then maybe we need to rethink our team dynamics.
options.analysis: You take a more critical stance, showing strong motivation but lower empathy and social skills.
